functions.population.prediction¶

Module for training population models and predicting population.

Module Contents¶

functions.population.prediction.pop_histogram(y, ax, y_label)¶

Plot histogram of population

functions.population.prediction.get_split(df, k, verbose=True)¶

Return training/validation split for fold k in df

functions.population.prediction.get_metrics(y_true, y_pred)¶

return metrics computed on observed and predicted values formatted for table

functions.population.prediction.cross_val(reg_master, df, features, target, return_models=True, log=False)¶

Train regression model using cross-validation on dataframe pre-split into folds.

Parameters

  • reg_master (sklearn.model_selection.GridSearchCV) – A grid search instance to be trained.

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – The dataframe used for training and validation.

  • features (list of str) – The dataframe columns used as features during training.

  • target (str) – The dataframe column used as target variable during training.

  • return_models (bool, optional) – Whether to return models. Defaults to False.

  • log (bool, optional) – Whether to predict predict log of target. Defaults to False.

Returns

Model predictions for each row of the dataframe, model variance for each row of the dataframe, and list of model trained on each cross validation fold returned if return_models is True.

Return type

(np.ndarray, np.ndarray, list of model)

functions.population.prediction.run_experiment(df, features, cvs, logs, model_names, target='pop')¶

Run experiment by training given models with specified feature set. Results are saved to dataframe.

Parameters

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – The dataframe used for training and validation.

  • features (list of str) – The dataframe columns used as features during training.

  • cvs (list of sklearn.model_selection.GridSearchCV) – Grid search instance for each model.

  • logs (list of bool) – Whether to predict predict log of target for each model.

  • model_names (list of str) – Name of each model.

  • target (str, optional) – The dataframe column used as target variable during training. Defaults to ‘pop’.

Returns

List of models trained on df via cross validation.

Return type

list of sklearn.base.BaseEstimator

functions.population.prediction.plot_model(model, ax, df, features, model_name, out_dir, plot_full)¶

Plot prediction error and feature importance for model.

functions.population.prediction.run_experiments(df_master, cvs, model_names, logs, features_list, out_dir_list, experiment_dir, plot_full=True, ignore_outliers_val=True, ignore_zeros_val=True, target='pop')¶
Parameters

  • df_master (pd.DataFrame) – The dataframe used to run the experiments.

  • cvs (list of sklearn.model_selection.GridSearchCV) – Grid search instance for each model.

  • model_names (list of str) – Name of each model.

  • logs (list of bool) – Whether to predict predict log of target for each model.

  • features_list (list of str) – Dataframe columns to use as features in each experiment.

  • out_dir_list (list of str) – Directories to output results of each experiment.

  • experiment_dir – Parent directory for experiment directories.

  • plot_full (bool, optional) – Whether or not to plot feature importance with full feature set. Avoid for large feature sets. Defaults to True.

  • ignore_outliers_val (bool, optional) – Whether to always ignore outlier tiles during validation. Defaults to True.

  • ignore_zeros_val (bool, optional) – Whether to always ignore zero population tiles during validation. Defaults to True.

  • target (str, optional) – The dataframe column used as target variable during training. Defaults to ‘pop’.

Returns

None.

functions.population.prediction.run_predictions(df, params, prng)¶

Run experiments described in params over dataset df.

functions.population.prediction.to_raster(df, target, shape)¶

Convert df[target] to raster of specified shape.

functions.population.prediction.run_estimation(df, df_full, params, prng)¶

Run estimation across full roi(s) based on params.
